Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.clientSide.viewCore.status

Enum ViewStatus

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Enum<ViewStatus>
it.polimi.ingsw.view.clientSide.viewCore.status.ViewStatus
All Implemented Interfaces:
ClientAddressable, Addressable, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<ViewStatus>, java.lang.constant.Constable
public enum ViewStatus
extends java.lang.Enum<ViewStatus>
implements ClientAddressable
Enumeration type for representing different status by which manage the Client behavior. It's a kind of FSM with each element of the enum corresponding to one status.
Author:
giorgio

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Enum

    java.lang.Enum.EnumDesc<E extends java.lang.Enum<E>>

  • Enum Constant Summary

    Enum Constants 
    Enum Constant Description
    CLOSING
    closing status.
    GAME_OVER
    Ending status.
    GAME_PREPARATION
    After having initialised the objects for the game, in this status the player initialises the game itself (by selecting the cards, placing the workers, ...)
    LOGIN
    After having established a connection, the next status is the log in status.
    NEW_GAME
    This status is (obviously) the beginning of the game.
    NUMBER_PLAYER
    status in which the challenger has to choose with how many other players it's going to play.
    PLAYING
    The core of the game: it is in this status that the game take place: it's here that the turns alternate and it is here where the game is played.
    READY
    Initial status intended to establish a connection with the server (and state a welcome message).
    REQUEST_RESUMING
    Requiring the challenger if it wants to resume a previously started game.
    RESUMING
    Status in which are loaded all the information about the game to restore
    WAITING
    After the login, the player will be placed into a "waiting room" waiting for the other players to connect.

  • Enum Constant Details

    • READY

      public static final ViewStatus READY
      Initial status intended to establish a connection with the server (and state a welcome message).

    • LOGIN

      public static final ViewStatus LOGIN
      After having established a connection, the next status is the log in status. In this status the player will choose its name and it will be sent to the server.

    • WAITING

      public static final ViewStatus WAITING
      After the login, the player will be placed into a "waiting room" waiting for the other players to connect. To exit this status it waits for the server to notify the starting of the game.

    • NEW_GAME

      public static final ViewStatus NEW_GAME
      This status is (obviously) the beginning of the game. In this status the player won't do anything, the only things done are the initialisations of all the objects used in the game.

    • GAME_PREPARATION

      public static final ViewStatus GAME_PREPARATION
      After having initialised the objects for the game, in this status the player initialises the game itself (by selecting the cards, placing the workers, ...)

    • PLAYING

      public static final ViewStatus PLAYING
      The core of the game: it is in this status that the game take place: it's here that the turns alternate and it is here where the game is played.

    • GAME_OVER

      public static final ViewStatus GAME_OVER
      Ending status.

    • NUMBER_PLAYER

      public static final ViewStatus NUMBER_PLAYER
      status in which the challenger has to choose with how many other players it's going to play.

    • CLOSING

      public static final ViewStatus CLOSING
      closing status.

    • REQUEST_RESUMING

      public static final ViewStatus REQUEST_RESUMING
      Requiring the challenger if it wants to resume a previously started game.

    • RESUMING

      public static final ViewStatus RESUMING
      Status in which are loaded all the information about the game to restore
